instruction_text:
To resolve OneDrive sync problems:

1. Check OneDrive status:
   - Look at OneDrive icon in system tray
   - Check sync status (cloud icon, sync icon, error icon)
   - Right-click icon > View sync problems
   - Check for error messages

2. Pause and resume sync:
   - Right-click OneDrive icon > Settings
   - Account tab > Choose folders
   - Or: Right-click icon > Pause syncing (2 hours)
   - Resume after pause period

3. Check available storage:
   - Verify OneDrive storage quota
   - Check local disk space
   - Free up space if needed
   - OneDrive needs space to sync

4. Sign out and sign back in:
   - Right-click OneDrive icon > Settings
   - Account tab > Unlink this PC
   - Sign back in with credentials
   - Choose folders to sync

5. Check file/folder issues:
   - Look for files with sync errors
   - Check for files with special characters
   - Verify file names aren't too long
   - Check for path length limits (260 characters)

6. Clear OneDrive cache:
   - Close OneDrive
   - Delete: %LocalAppData%\Microsoft\OneDrive\cache
   - Restart OneDrive
   - Sign in again

7. Reset OneDrive:
   - Close OneDrive completely
   - Run: %LocalAppData%\Microsoft\OneDrive\onedrive.exe /reset
   - Or use Reset option in Settings
   - Reconfigure sync settings

8. Check network connectivity:
   - Verify internet connection
   - Test OneDrive website access
   - Check firewall/proxy settings
   - Verify OneDrive URLs aren't blocked

9. Check for file conflicts:
   - OneDrive website > View sync problems
   - Resolve any file conflicts
   - Choose which version to keep
   - Delete conflicting copies if needed

10. Update OneDrive:
    - Check for OneDrive updates
    - Update via Microsoft Store or Office
    - Restart OneDrive after update

11. Check selective sync:
    - Right-click OneDrive icon > Settings
    - Account tab > Choose folders
    - Verify correct folders are synced
    - Re-select folders if needed

12. Check file permissions:
    - Verify you have access to files
    - Check sharing permissions
    - Ensure files aren't read-only

13. Run OneDrive troubleshooter:
    - Settings > Update & Security > Troubleshoot
    - Run OneDrive sync troubleshooter
    - Follow troubleshooting steps

14. Check antivirus/firewall:
    - Add OneDrive to antivirus exclusions
    - Check firewall allows OneDrive
    - Temporarily disable to test

15. Reinstall OneDrive:
    - Uninstall OneDrive
    - Download fresh from Microsoft
    - Reinstall and configure

16. Check for large files:
    - Identify files larger than 250GB (limit)
    - Files over 15GB may have issues
    - Consider splitting or compressing

17. Check sync status online:
    - Go to onedrive.com
    - Check if files appear online
    - Compare with local files

18. Contact Microsoft support:
    - If persistent issues
    - Check service status
    - May need account-level assistance
